intro: Lilium hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy lily, is a species of flowering plant in the Liliaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its striking, often fragrant, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, with broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its bulbs are underground storage organs that help the plant survive harsh winter conditions. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, adding a vibrant touch to gardens and natural landscapes.
